sentences: Tüdrukuke oli otse ema suust kukkunud – samasuguste suurte helesiniste silmadega, nagu Liina ise oli olnud.
context: The Estonian word 'suust' is the elative singular form of 'suu', which means 'mouth'. It indicates movement or origin from inside the mouth, translating to English as 'from the mouth' or 'out of the mouth'. This case (elative) shows where something comes out from or originates from within something else - in this case, from inside the mouth.
